Brazil.description: Brazil holds the largest share of the Amazon rainforest.

Colombia.description: Colombia has rich biodiversity and multiple indigenous communities in the Amazon.

Peru.description: Peru has the second largest portion of the Amazon after Brazil.

Bolivia.description: Bolivia’s Amazon region is known for its ecological transition zones and indigenous cultures.

Ecuador.description: Ecuador’s Amazon region is compact but highly biodiverse.

Venezuela.description: Venezuela’s Amazon includes the Guayana Shield, one of the oldest geological formations on Earth.

Guyana.description: Guyana's untouched forests and river systems support abundant wildlife and carbon sinks.

Suriname.description: Suriname has one of the highest forest covers in the world, with low deforestation rates.
